endpoint.description:
URL for Nutanix Prism (e.g IP or FQDN for cluster VIP
note, this is never the data services VIP, and should not be an
individual CVM address, as this would cause calls to fail during
cluster lifecycle management operations, such as AOS upgrades.

foundation_endpoint.description: endpoint for foundation VM (eg. Foundation VM IP)

insecure.description: Explicitly allow the provider to perform "insecure" SSL requests. If omitted,default value is `false`

session_auth.description: Use session authentification instead of basic auth for each request

username.description:
User name for Nutanix Prism. Could be
local cluster auth (e.g. 'admin') or directory auth.

wait_timeout.description: Set if you know that the creation o update of a resource may take long time (minutes)

ext_id.description: Cluster UUID of a remote cluster.

accessible_clients.description: List of Accessible Clients for the Role.

accessible_entity_types.description: List of Accessible Entity Types for the Role.

assigned_users_count.description: Number of Users assigned to given Role.

assigned_users_groups_count.description: Number of User Groups assigned to given Role.

display_name.description: The display name for the Role.

is_system_defined.description: Flag identifying if the Role is system defined or not.

links.description: A HATEOAS style link for the response. Each link contains a user-friendly name identifying the link and an address for retrieving the particular resource.

operations.description: List of Operations for the Role.

description.description: Volume Disk description. This is an optional field.

disk_size_bytes.description: Size of the disk in bytes. This field is mandatory during Volume Group creation if a new disk is being created on the storage container.

ext_id.description: A globally unique identifier of an instance that is suitable for external consumption.

index.description: Index of the disk in a Volume Group. This field is optional and immutable.

volume_group_ext_id.description: The external identifier of the volume group.

entity_type.description: The Entity Type of the Data Source Reference.

ext_id.description: The external identifier of the Data Source Reference.

name.description: The name of the Data Source Reference.

uris.description: The uri list of the Data Source Reference.

block.description: Disk Data Source Reference.

is_enabled.description: The flash mode is enabled or not.

block.description: Once configured, this field will avoid down migration of data from the hot tier unless the overrides field is specified for the virtual disks.
Storage optimization features which must be enabled on the Volume Disks. This is an optional field. If omitted, the disks will honor the Volume Group specific storage features setting.
Creates a new Volume Disk.

attachment_site.description: The site where the Volume Group attach operation should be processed. This is an optional field. This field may only be set if Metro DR has been configured for this Volume Group.

client_secret.description: iSCSI initiator client secret in case of CHAP authentication. This field should not be provided in case the authentication type is not set to CHAP..

enabled_authentications.description: The authentication type enabled for the Volume Group. This is an optional field. If omitted, authentication is not configured for the Volume Group. If this is set to CHAP, the target/client secret must be provided.

ext_id.description: A globally unique identifier of an instance that is suitable for external consumption.

iscsi_initiator_name.description: iSCSI initiator name. During the attach operation, exactly one of iscsiInitiatorName and iscsiInitiatorNetworkID must be specified. This field is immutable.

num_virtual_targets.description: Number of virtual targets generated for the iSCSI target. This field is immutable.

vg_ext_id.description: The external identifier of the Volume Group.

value.description: A fully qualified domain name that specifies its exact location in the tree hierarchy of the Domain Name System.

block.description: A fully qualified domain name that specifies its exact location in the tree hierarchy of the Domain Name System.

prefix_length.description: The prefix length of the network to which this host IPv4 address belongs.

value.description: An unique address that identifies a device on the internet or a local network in IPv4 format.

block.description: An unique address that identifies a device on the internet or a local network in IPv4 format.

prefix_length.description: The prefix length of the network to which this host IPv6 address belongs.

value.description: An unique address that identifies a device on the internet or a local network in IPv6 format.

block.description: An unique address that identifies a device on the internet or a local network in IPv6 format.
An unique address that identifies a device on the internet or a local network in IPv4/IPv6 format or a Fully Qualified Domain Name.
Attach iSCSI initiator to a Volume Group identified by {extId}

cluster_reference.description: The UUID of the cluster that will host the Volume Group. This is a mandatory field for creating a Volume Group on Prism Central.

created_by.description: Service/user who created this Volume Group. This is an optional field.

description.description: Volume Group description. This is an optional field.

enabled_authentications.description: The authentication type enabled for the Volume Group. This is an optional field. If omitted, authentication is not configured for the Volume Group. If this is set to CHAP, the target/client secret must be provided.

ext_id.description: A globally unique identifier of an instance that is suitable for external consumption.

name.description: Volume Group name. This is an Required field.

sharing_status.description: Indicates whether the Volume Group can be shared across multiple iSCSI initiators. The mode cannot be changed from SHARED to NOT_SHARED on a Volume Group with multiple attachments. Similarly, a Volume Group cannot be associated with more than one attachment as long as it is in exclusive mode. This is an optional field.

should_load_balance_vm_attachments.description: Indicates whether to enable Volume Group load balancing for VM attachments. This cannot be enabled if there are iSCSI client attachments already associated with the Volume Group, and vice-versa. This is an optional field.

target_name.description: Name of the external client target that will be visible and accessible to the client. This is an optional field.

target_prefix.description: The specifications contain the target prefix for external clients as the value. This is an optional field.

usage_type.description: Expected usage type for the Volume Group. This is an indicative hint on how the caller will consume the Volume Group. This is an optional field.

enabled_authentications.description: The authentication type enabled for the Volume Group. This is an optional field. If omitted, authentication is not configured for the Volume Group. If this is set to CHAP, the target/client secret must be provided.

target_secret.description: Target secret in case of a CHAP authentication. This field must only be provided in case the authentication type is not set to CHAP. This is an optional field and it cannot be retrieved once configured.

block.description: iSCSI specific settings for the Volume Group. This is an optional field.

is_enabled.description: Indicates whether the flash mode is enabled for the Volume Group.

block.description: Once configured, this field will avoid down migration of data from the hot tier unless the overrides field is specified for the virtual disks.
Storage optimization features which must be enabled on the Volume Group. This is an optional field.
Creates a new Volume Group.

ext_id.description: A globally unique identifier of a task.

index.description: The index on the SCSI bus to attach the VM to the Volume Group. This is an optional field.

vm_ext_id.description: A globally unique identifier of an instance that is suitable for external consumption. This Field is Required.

volume_group_ext_id.description: The external identifier of the volume group.

block.description: Attaches VM to a Volume Group identified by {extId}.

accessible_clients.description: List of Accessible Clients for the Role.

accessible_entity_types.description: List of Accessible Entity Types for the Role.

assigned_users_count.description: Number of Users assigned to given Role.

assigned_users_groups_count.description: Number of User Groups assigned to given Role.

created_by.description: User or Service Name that created the Role.

created_time.description: The creation time of the Role.

display_name.description: The display name for the Role.

is_system_defined.description: Flag identifying if the Role is system defined or not.

last_updated_time.description: The time when the Role was last updated.

links.description: A HATEOAS style link for the response. Each link contains a user-friendly name identifying the link and an address for retrieving the particular resource.

operations.description: List of Operations for the Role.

limit.description: A URL query parameter that specifies the total number of records returned in the result set. Must be a positive integer between 1 and 100. Any number out of this range will lead to a validation error. If the limit is not provided, a default value of 50 records will be returned in the result set.

page.description: A URL query parameter that specifies the page number of the result set. It must be a positive integer between 0 and the maximum number of pages that are available for that resource. Any number out of this range might lead to no results.

is_system_defined.description: specifying whether it is a system defined service group

description.description: Volume Disk description. This is an optional field.

disk_size_bytes.description: Size of the disk in bytes. This field is mandatory during Volume Group creation if a new disk is being created on the storage container.

disk_storage_features.description: Storage optimization features which must be enabled on the Volume Disks. This is an optional field. If omitted, the disks will honor the Volume Group specific storage features setting.

ext_id.description: The external identifier of the Volume Disk.

index.description: Index of the disk in a Volume Group. This field is optional and immutable.

links.description: A HATEOAS style link for the response. Each link contains a user-friendly name identifying the link and an address for retrieving the particular resource.

storage_container_id.description: Storage container on which the disk must be created. This is a read-only field.

tenant_id.description: A globally unique identifier that represents the tenant that owns this entity. The system automatically assigns it, and it and is immutable from an API consumer perspective (some use cases may cause this Id to change - For instance, a use case may require the transfer of ownership of the entity, but these cases are handled automatically on the server).

volume_group_ext_id.description: The external identifier of the Volume Group.

block.description: Query the Volume Disk identified by {extId} in the Volume Group identified by {volumeGroupExtID}.

disks.description: List of disks corresponding to a Volume Group identified by {volumeGroupExtId}.

limit.description: A URL query parameter that specifies the total number of records returned in the result set. Must be a positive integer between 1 and 100. Any number out of this range will lead to a validation error. If the limit is not provided, a default value of 50 records will be returned in the result set.

orderby.description: A URL query parameter that allows clients to specify the sort criteria for the returned list of objects. Resources can be sorted in ascending order using asc or descending order using desc. If asc or desc are not specified, the resources will be sorted in ascending order by default. For example, '$orderby=templateName desc' would get all templates sorted by templateName in descending order. The orderby can be applied to the following fields: diskSizeBytes

page.description: A URL query parameter that specifies the page number of the result set. It must be a positive integer between 0 and the maximum number of pages that are available for that resource. Any number out of this range might lead to no results.

select.description: A URL query parameter that allows clients to request a specific set of properties for each entity or complex type. Expression specified with the $select must conform to the OData V4.01 URL conventions. If a $select expression consists of a single select item that is an asterisk (i.e., *), then all properties on the matching resource will be returned. The select can be applied to the following fields: extId, storageContainerId

volume_group_ext_id.description: The external identifier of the Volume Group.

block.description: Query the list of disks corresponding to a Volume Group identified by {volumeGroupExtId}.

cluster_reference.description: The UUID of the cluster that will host the Volume Group. This is a mandatory field for creating a Volume Group on Prism Central.

created_by.description: Service/user who created this Volume Group. This is an optional field.

description.description: Volume Group description. This is an optional field.

enabled_authentications.description: The authentication type enabled for the Volume Group. This is an optional field. If omitted, authentication is not configured for the Volume Group. If this is set to CHAP, the target/client secret must be provided.

ext_id.description: The external identifier of the Volume Group.

is_hidden.description: Indicates whether the Volume Group is meant to be hidden or not. This is an optional field. If omitted, the VG will not be hidden.

iscsi_features.description: iSCSI specific settings for the Volume Group. This is an optional field.

links.description: A HATEOAS style link for the response. Each link contains a user-friendly name identifying the link and an address for retrieving the particular resource.

name.description: Volume Group name. This is an optional field.

sharing_status.description: Indicates whether the Volume Group can be shared across multiple iSCSI initiators. The mode cannot be changed from SHARED to NOT_SHARED on a Volume Group with multiple attachments. Similarly, a Volume Group cannot be associated with more than one attachment as long as it is in exclusive mode. This is an optional field. Possible values [SHARED, NOT_SHARED]

should_load_balance_vm_attachments.description: Indicates whether to enable Volume Group load balancing for VM attachments. This cannot be enabled if there are iSCSI client attachments already associated with the Volume Group, and vice-versa. This is an optional field.

storage_features.description: Storage optimization features which must be enabled on the Volume Group. This is an optional field.

target_name.description: Name of the external client target that will be visible and accessible to the client. This is an optional field.

tenant_id.description: A globally unique identifier that represents the tenant that owns this entity. The system automatically assigns it, and it and is immutable from an API consumer perspective (some use cases may cause this Id to change - For instance, a use case may require the transfer of ownership of the entity, but these cases are handled automatically on the server).

usage_type.description: Expected usage type for the Volume Group. This is an indicative hint on how the caller will consume the Volume Group. This is an optional

block.description: Query the Volume Group identified by {extId}.

limit.description: A URL query parameter that specifies the total number of records returned in the result set. Must be a positive integer between 1 and 100. Any number out of this range will lead to a validation error. If the limit is not provided, a default value of 50 records will be returned in the result set.

orderby.description: A URL query parameter that allows clients to specify the sort criteria for the returned list of objects. Resources can be sorted in ascending order using asc or descending order using desc. If asc or desc are not specified, the resources will be sorted in ascending order by default. For example, '$orderby=templateName desc' would get all templates sorted by templateName in descending order. The orderby can be applied to the following fields: clusterReference, extId, name

page.description: A URL query parameter that specifies the page number of the result set. It must be a positive integer between 0 and the maximum number of pages that are available for that resource. Any number out of this range might lead to no results.

select.description: A URL query parameter that allows clients to request a specific set of properties for each entity or complex type. Expression specified with the $select must conform to the OData V4.01 URL conventions. If a $select expression consists of a single select item that is an asterisk (i.e., *), then all properties on the matching resource will be returned. The select can be applied to the following fields: clusterReference, extId, name

enabled_authentications.description: The authentication type enabled for the Volume Group. This is an optional field. If omitted, authentication is not configured for the Volume Group. If this is set to CHAP, the target/client secret must be provided.

ext_id.description: The external identifier of the iSCSI client.

iscsi_initiator_name.description: iSCSI initiator name. During the attach operation, exactly one of iscsiInitiatorName and iscsiInitiatorNetworkId must be specified. This field is immutable.
